title: RBI Grade B - FM - FLM1 - Objective

quiz.text: In Google, the communication flows from the CEO to general manager, and eventually it reaches the departmental heads and other junior employees. CEOs of google, Sundar Pichai, convey work-related information including employees’ performance feedback, job instructions, as well as the organization’s vision and mission.Identify the channel of communication opted by Google.
options: Upward Communication
Lateral Communication
crosswise communication
Horizontal Communication
None of the above

quiz.text: In the field of Time Value of Money (TVM), Interest paid (earned) on the original principal borrowed (lent) is often referred to as ?
options: Future Value.
Present Value.
Simple Interest.
Compound Interest.
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is not a motivational factor according to Herzberg's motivation-hygiene theory?
options: Achievement
Possibility of Growth
The work Itself
Personal Life
Recognition

quiz.text: Which Principle of Planning tells that maximum results should be obtained from minimum costs and efforts?
options: Principle of Contribution to Objectives
Principle of Efficiency
Principle of Framework
Principle of Delegation
None of the above

quiz.text: The earning per share of the XYZ limited is Rs. 5.00. The investors expect a PE ratio of 20 being appropriate for this company. What should be the price of the share?
options: Rs 25
Rs 30
Rs 100
Rs 400
None of the above

quiz.text: What is the formula to calculate the Cost of Goods Sold (COGS)?
options: Opening Inventory + Purchases made during the Period + Direct Expenses + Closing Inventory
Opening Inventory - Purchases made during the Period + Direct Expenses - Closing Inventory
Opening Inventory + Purchases made during the Period - Direct Expenses - Closing Inventory
Opening Inventory - Purchases made during the Period - Direct Expenses + Closing Inventory
Opening Inventory + Purchases made during the Period + Direct Expenses - Closing Inventory

quiz.text: Which of the following is false with relation to Banking Correspondent Model?
options: NGOs/MFIs set up under the Societies/Trust Acts can operate as banking correspondent model
BCs can charge maximum of 2% of the loan amount as commission from the people availing the loans
BCs are allowed to disburse credit and collect interest and principal to be repaid by the person availing the loan
BCs in addition to normal banking services are also allowed to sell micro-insurance/mutual fund products/pension products
None of the above

quiz.text: A holder of an ADR/GDR does not have right to _____.
options: Vote
Receive dividend
Eeceive corporate action notification
Trade the ADRs/GDRs in the stock market
None of the above

quiz.text: The minimum gap between 2 buybacks of shares should be____________.
options: 1 year
2 year
3 year
4 year
There is no such time limit

quiz.text: From the Big Five personality dimensions, behaviors such as speaking fluently, displaying ambition, and exhibiting a high degree of intelligence is __________
options: Agreeableness
Openness
Extraversion
Conscientiousness
Neuroticism

quiz.text: Which of the following pairs are correctly matched?1. Disinflation: Reduction in the rate of inflation2. Deflation: Persistent decrease in the price level (negative inflation)3. Reflation: Price level increases when the economy recovers from recession based on the value of inflation
options: Only 1
Only 2
2 and 3
1 and 3
1, 2 and 3

quiz.text: Which of the following statement is/are false 1. Written Communication is Conversational and indirect where as Oral Communication is precise and direct 2. Written Communication is retractable but Oral Communication not retractable 3. Written Communication is better as one can get immediate feedback where as in Oral Communication people do not get immediate feedback 4. Written Communication is done with more deliberation and thought as compared to Oral Communication
options: Only 1
Only 1 and 2
Only 1, 2 and 3
Only 1 and 4
All of 1, 2, 3 and 4

quiz.text: Which of the following statement is correct about the Open system prepaid payment instruments (PPIs)? 1. These PPI are issued by any entity for facilitating the purchase of goods and services from that entity only. 2. These PPI can only be issued by banks after getting approval from the reserve bank of India. 3. Cash withdrawal through ATMs is also allowed through such PPIs
options: Only 2
Only 1 and 3
Only 1 and 2
Only 2 and 3
All of the above

quiz.text: Consider the following statements and choose the correct one(s)! 1. The Standing Deposit Facility was first recommended by the Narsimham Committee on Banking Sector Reforms 2. This facility will not require a collateral 3. This will allow the RBI to absorb surplus funds from banks
options: Only 1
1 and 2
2 and 3
1 and 3
1,2 and 3

quiz.text: The central government may issue the RBI-specific instructions from time to time, which the RBI must implement.Which section of the RBI Act ensures that the Government can legitimately make such a suggestion?
options: Section-5
Section-6
Section-7
Section-8
Section-9

quiz.text: Calculate the total amount of tangible assets for the above balance sheet?
options: 6,50,000
7,00,000
8,00,000
9,00,000
10,00,000

quiz.text: Consider the following statements concerning the Birla Committee's recommendations and choose the correct ones!1. The Board of directors of a company should have an optimum combination of executive and non-executive directors2. Board meetings should be held at least three times a year3. These recommendations were incorporated in the SEBI listing agreements
options: Only 1
Only 3
1 and 2
2 and 3
1 and 3

quiz.text: Arun believes that he can get extra work done by his subordinates by close supervision. He also instils fear on a bonus being refused if deadlines are not met. Arun could be described as _____________
options: Theory X manager, according to McGregor
Theory Y manager, according to McGregor
Theory Z manager, according to Ouchi
Manager who meets Maslow's esteem needs of employees
None of the above
1-b; 2-c; 3-e; 4-c ; 5-d
1-b; 2-c; 3-a; 4-c ; 5-d
1-b; 2-c; 3-c; 4-e ; 5-d
1-b; 2-c; 3-e; 4-a ; 5-d
1-b; 2-c; 3-e; 4-b ; 5-d

quiz.text: In the move for bringing revolution in India, Tata Motors’ plans to boost its EV business in India. The homegrown automaker is planning to work towards building a range of affordable electric cars. A report suggests that the company plans to price its green cars at not more than 15-20% premium to conventional petrol/diesel vehicles. Tata Motors is thinking on a combination of network expansion, dealer development and product repositioning to turn around its passenger vehicle sales.From the above paragraph, identify the function of management, which is being performed by the Tata Motor's
options: Organizing
Controlling
Staffing
Coordination
Planning

quiz.text: According to David Goleman, which of the following is not an element of emotional intelligence?
options: Self Awareness
Empathy
Motivation
Management
Social skills

quiz.text: You are given the following Balance Sheets of ABC Ltd. Further, depreciation of Rs. 60,000 on Plant & Machinery was charged to the P&L account during the year. No income tax was paid during the year. Find the net cash from financing activities during the year.
options: 25,000
30,000
15,000
20,000
None of the above

quiz.text: Recently (June 2023), the Securities & Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has introduced ASBA like process for trading in secondary market. What does ‘B’ in ASBA stands for?
options: Bank
Board
Balance
Broker
Blocked

quiz.text: Recently (July 2023), the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has launched Centralised Information Management System (CIMS) during the 17th Statistics Day Conference in Mumbai. Which of the following will report on CIMS?A.      Commercial BankB.      Cooperative BanksC.      Non-Banking Financial Companies (NBFCs)
options: A and B
B only
A only
A and C
A, B and C

quiz.text: Recently (June 2023), the State Bank of India (SBI) has paid a dividend cheque of ________, the highest ever dividend payment by the SBI to the Government of India for a financial year.
options: Rs 8,740 crore
Rs 5,740 crore
Rs 4,740 crore
Rs 6,740 crore
Rs 7,740 crore

quiz.text: According to recently (In June), released data by the RBI, the foreign exchange reserves decreased by _________ during 2022-23 as against an accretion of US$ 47.5 billion during 2021-22.
options: US$ 9.1 billion
US$ 8.1 billion
US$ 6.1 billion
US$ 7.1 billion
US$ 3.1 billion

quiz.text: According to recently (In June), released data by the RBI, India’s external debt, at end-March 2023, increased by $5.6 billion to _________from the year-earlier.
options: $630.7 billion
$624.7 billion
$628.7 billion
$620.7 billion
$634.7 billion

quiz.text: According to recently (In June), released data by the RBI, what were the net foreign direct investment (FDI) in the fourth quarter of 2022-23?
options: $6.9 billion
$6.8 billion
$6.6 billion
$6.4 billion
$6.2 billion

quiz.text: What is the minimum requirement for CRAR (Capital to Risk Weighted Assets Ratio) for an Urban Co-operative Bank (UCB) to be classified as Financially Sound and Well Managed (FSWM)?
options: 1 percentage point above the minimum CRAR applicable to an UCB
0.5 percentage points above the minimum CRAR applicable to an UCB
1.5 percentage points above the minimum CRAR applicable to an UCB
2 percentage points above the minimum CRAR applicable to an UCB
None of the above

quiz.text: Recently RBI released “All-India House Price Index (HPI) for Q4:2022-23”, what is the base year for the Reserve Bank's House Price Index (HPI)?
options: 2011-12
2010-11
2012-13
2013-14
2009-10
